explain_money: i like money more than oatmeal cookies
I think it's the right thing to do, and I'm hoping she will choose the same thing, that way we can both get the same amount of money.
Because I want the money and I do not know my partner. I also think I would put this money to good use at the bar.
Money is a very tricky and serious thing, so I decided to go completely even on it so that nobody felt upset or cheated on. I think that money is an important thing to share in this case.
Since it was randomly given to us (not earned), I decided to split it evenly amongst the two of us.

I allocated slightly more money to myself as I have just met this person and do not have any personal or emotional connection to them. I wanted to be somewhat fair, so I only took one extra dollar for myself and gave the rest to my partner.

My thought process was that we would just split the $10 fairly, so that we each get $5. After talking with my partner, we are both here as a requirement for class, so I thought it was fair that we would both get the same amount for doing something with for a class and being good students.
I gave 5 to each of us because I feel that we both value the money. I feel that it would be most fair for us to split it evenly.
I think the money should be split evenly. regardless of what the product is, the best way to have both people satisfied with the result is by splitting it 50/50.
Just like the answer to the question above, felt it would be fair to split the money with my partner so we each get 50% of it.
Because taking more than half wouldn't benefit me much so might as well chop it down the middle
I gave us each half because that is the most fair option. We each get the same amount

5 and 5 made the most sense in this scenario because it felt fair. I didn't feel the need to give up more than 5 dollars because I don't know very much about my partner, but didn't want to give less than 5 in the case he would appreciate the $5.
I'm not greedy. I feel like since I didn't earn the money and it was just randomly given to me, I don't mind splitting it.

I allocated the portion of $10 evenly between myself and the other participant because I know that we both can use the money, and it wouldn't be fair to take it all or more. My family raised me to share and be equal with others which is why is split the $10 evenly between us.
I split the dollars evenly. I thought that this would be the fairest.
We should split the money evenly because it is the most fair.
$10 isn't really a lot of money today, so I just split it equally between the two of us because I think it's nice and I would feel honored if my partner did the same for me.
I split the money fifty-fifty because my partner and I had just met prior to the study. I felt as if neither of us would be comfortable with taking more money than the other.
I gave the other participant $5 so it was equal. We both would receive the same amount.
I split it evenly. I don't know anything about my partner, so I can't assume that he would need the money more than me. So, I just gave him half and I kept half.

I thought splitting the money in half was the fairest option. Even though you can't do much with $5 each, I thought it would be nice to keep the amount equal because $5 is still $5 we didn't have before.
When asked to allocate this proportion of money I decided to split it evenly. I did this because it seemed most fair and just.
Because I took 6 oatmeal packets, I should only get $4. That way, we both get 10 items in total out of the 20 items.
I do not need $10. I do not know the situation of my study partner  so I just gave it to them.
10$ doesn't get you anything in this economy
I do not really know this person very well at all. I thought giving them a dollar out of the $10 would be nice but I don't know them so I did not split it even.
I choose 50/50 share. I think she is kind. She deserved to have half of the money.
It's considerate to do an even slip. There's nothing that we know, since we just met each other that would indicate we should divide it differently.

I divided up the 10 bills in half to share, so i would get 5 and my partner would get 5. I felt like that was a fair way to do it and it made sure it was distributed evenly. since I don't know my parter well enough, I couldnt decide if she may need to money more or less than me, so i fugured I would split it 50-50.
I decided to split the money evenly between the two of us because I don't think that it's fair to take more. We both could use the money on something we want so I decided to split the money.

I would split the money so that we both got $5, because although I could have allocated more to myself, we are both better off and it is fair that we split the money evenly. We are both doing the same amount of work in this study/class and as college students, we could both use $5.
I just want to be fair. I would have wanted them to give me some money as well.
I thought it was fair, and they were likely being asked the same questions.
I split these even because money is something that almost everyone values so I thought it would only be fair to do it this way.

I allocated the amount of 10 dollars to myself and none to my partner because as a college student I need as much money as I can get. It is nothing against my partner, but I would love that money for myself and spend it how I want.
I have no issue with splitting the $10 evenly so that both of us are fairly compensated. I would feel bad if I took extra for myself when I don't really need it.
I would split the money in half with them because thats what i would want them to do for me
It only seems fair to give each of us five. Since we don't know each other well it makes it simpler to just split them.
I do not know her that well. I could use $10. I do not feel the need to split it with someone I don't know.
it is fair. My partner has good vibes.
I wanted it to be fair, and I did not want to be greedy.

Well i put 10 because i didn't have a partner, but hypothetically if i did we could go 5 and 5 just so there's no bad blood between us and I didn't plan on getting 10 anyways so any amount is good to me. Plus, good karma points
I think this resource is equally beneficial to each of us to I split it equally between us. Both could benefit from 5 dollars.

I feel like people can use money for either what they want or what they need, so if I am proposed with the challenge of taking or the splitting the money, I feel that it wouldn't be fair if I took more than my partner. Especially if my partner knew, I would feel even worse. If I split it evenly then we both benefit equally.
Typically everyone wants money. I would not want my partner to be upset if I took an unfair amount
I chose to keep the money. I wanted to keep the money because I wanted the money for myself.
I gave my partner 5 and me 5 because as much as I would enjoy all $10, it is not that much money and I did not mind splitting it evenly.
I split it 50 50. There was no reason for splitting it so that was the most even.
I chose to split the amount of money evenly between us. We both want money I'm assuming as anyone would, so I want to keep it fair. I would hope that she would do the same.

Seeing as I don't know this person at all, I'd feel slightly strange offering them money out of nowhere. I also think I'd be able to put it to good use, while I don't really know this person enough to say the same.

I was given 10 dollars for free with no personal cost and was given the task to allocate it so its only fair if I allocate that money fairly because I deserve it as much as the other person since neither of us did anything to earn it

I decided that we each get 5 dollars because I believe it is the fairest. Also, if one of us got 7 and the other got 3 there isn't much you can do with 3 dollars so at that point you might as well go 10 and 0.
I thought it was only fair to give her half. It would be selfish for me to take all of the money
Even split, win win

I split the bills evenly because that is what's fair. I didn't choose to be the one making the decision, so I shouldn't be able to choose who gets more. I would expect the same level of fairness from my partner or anyone else making this decision.

I gave myself 6 dollars and the other participant 4 dollars because I was thinking more about myself in this case with inflation having a huge toll in the economy anything more than 5 dollars will be able to get me groceries or food so that's why I chose to give myself more.
i cannot be selfish so half half. he has every right to the amount i have

I allocated $5 to myself and $5 to my partner because I believe that is fair to split the $10 evenly between the both of us. I would always try to split something evenly between us, and if there was an odd amount of dollars, then I would happily take less and give more.
Same Explanation. She worked as hard as me and therefore we should be paid equally. I would feel bad if I would give myself more.
I split the money 50/50 because it was a gift allocated to both of us. I didn't do anything more to deserve it so it should be split evenly.
I decided to keep all the money for myself because I do not know my research partner. I feel no obligation to give her a portion of the money because of this. I would rather keep it all for myself.

I allocated $8 to myself and $2 to my partner because as much as I wanted the full $10, I did not think that it was fair so I decided to give them a little bit, and I believe that they would understand. I think anyone who was given this option would take all of the money for themselves and I thought that it would be nice to give my partner a share.
ten dollars doesn't mean much so I am willing to share it equally. I'm fortunate for what I have so I am willing to share.
I give most of the one dollar bills to myself because I would use them to buy necessities I know I need, while I don't know what the other participant would need the dollar bills for.
it is even between the both of us which i think is fair when it comes to money
I do not know this person very well. If I gave myself more money they would have a negative impression of me, which I don't want a random person having.
I decided to each give $5 to me and my partner. I think this is the most fair way to go about it
I gave both of us 5 dollars since it only seems fair. If I took it all, that would seem very greedy.

I allocated 5 one-dollar bills to the other participant and 5 to me because it is a fair split of the total dollars I got. If I knew of any of the other participant's needs for a bigger amount, I would allocate more.
There is no reason to not split the money. I did nothing different to my partner that would make me earn more money.
I would just want to split the money evenly, it is not a significant portion so there is no major gain from keeping all or most of it to myself, it would be fair and kind to split it evenly.
i have 4 he have 6 is very good. for my opion

I keep enough that I could buy basic necessities but if the other person was struggling or wanted to buy something, it would help her chip in towards the next purchase. The only way I would give less is if the other person would seem ungrateful if I were to help them, then I'd keep all of the money since it can help me out or someone who needs it more.

Just seemed fair if the money was going to both of us to split it up evenly. I could've been rude and taken all the money but it doesn't seem worth burning a possible connection for only $5 - I am not that greedy.
I would take all of this money to get lunch
I indicated that I would give 5 to myself and 5 to my research partner. I mean its only fair if we both get half of what I can give out. Anymore or any less would be rude to one or the other person.
We both participated in this study, so I feel like it is only fair we split the $10. She seemed nice otherwise I would just take the money.
I evenly split the money between myself and my partner. Considering we do not know each other at all, I have no reason to give them more or less than half.
I gave the participant half of the money just because we were both involved and deserve to split the pot. It is the easiest way to split money without getting into an argument.
I think if we go out together, we can separate the money we have.
i split the money evenly, 5 dollars to each of us. This way everything is fair, because one of us does not deserve more than the other, we did not do anything to deserve the money.
I would give each of us 5 because we were partners and both deserve and equal amount.
If we each had the possibility to have 10 dollars total I think it would be fair for both of us to have half.
i took 5 because why not and gave her 5 because why not
I felt like it would be unfair to just be handed $19 in front of somebody that is my partner and not share. So I did a 50/50 split.
I split the money evenly between my partner and I because that is the fairest option. I do not believe that I should receive more than her or vice versa.

I had said that I would split the money equally at $5 and $5 each as I figured that would be the fairest for both of us. As well as that, I figured that us both having $5 of the $10 would be much more overall useful in the long run than only I have the full $10.
I decided to split the money in half between us evenly. I feel like it was the easy option to do. Since we both had no money to begin with, we should each get an equal share.
I am hungry and need to eat, so 9 dollars would be great for a meal. She can have a dollar.
i even split the $10, $5 to me $5 to her. I chose this because we likely both want the money so an even split would work the best for this situation
split even
I split the money 50/50 because Max was a cool guy, and we got to know about each other. I also did this because that is the fairest outcome.
It would not be fair to take more money for myself. I divided it evenly because we are both doing equal work.

I allocated this amount to myself for multiple reasons. First, I wanted it to be an even balance. After I gave her almost all of my sugar, I believe that I should be receiving most of the cash. Second, cash to me is more valuable than sugar. If you have cash, you can do more with it than you could do with sugar. Finally, it's important for me to have something that I will actually use, as opposed to something that I won't use.
I would expect him to split it evenly, so I did. We both have the opportunity to split the money, so we each end up with $10 anyway.
Its just one dollar bills, the difference between 10 and 5 dollar bills isnt that crazy for me to be selfish
If I were given 10, it would feel wrong to give my partner anything less than half. So I gave them 5.
I chose to evenly distribute the money because that is fair.

I did a 5/5 ratio because it was even. We both were chosen randomly, and to be fair, we both should get the same amount of 1-dollar bills. This way, we both get the same amount, and one doesn't get more than the other, and it won't cause problems.
$10 is not much. I would get more value out of the joy of sharing it.

I chose to split the money with me getting $7 and partner getting $3. I need some spare money for snacks and stuff, so $7 is a good amount for that. It is my partner, so I didn't want to take all the money. It would be disrespectful to leave $1 or $2 so $3 is a good amount.
I gave $5 to both of us, so that we would be even. I would feel guilty taking more than half but want at least half for myself.
I split them 50/50. That is because I do not know her so I wouldn't give her more or less.
Splitting it equal seems fair and reasonable.
It would only be fair to split the money evenly. There is no reason that I should get more than my partner does.
I put that we each get 5 dollars.This way we both get the same amount and are happy
We're both strangers doing a study. There is no need for either one of us to get more than the other. So splitting it half-half makes the most sense and is the most fair.
I need money. If i have the choice to keep money or give it away, I am going to keep it.

I split the money evenly because $10 to myself in this economy would not have been that beneficial anyway. Also, even though I just met her she seems nice and I would like to think that she would do the same.
I allocated the money in this way because it is the most fair way I could do it. Any other split is unfair and rude.
Money is useful to everyone so I felt that it was the most fair to give each of us an equal amount. The other participant might also be annoyed if she got less money than me.

$10 is mutually appealing to both of us, so it makes sense to split it down the middle. Maybe if I found the $10 or if he did not want the whole $5 or wanted more, I would take more or less, depends on the scenario.

It is fair and just that we evenly split the money. If I had prior info that he needed an extra dollar or something then I would probably give it to him, but with the knowledge I have, it is fair to evenly split the ten dollars.

This is because it's a group study and I would feel bad for taking all the money that was given to me to distribute. Since we both go to the same school and might run into each other I'd rather him see me in a positive light.
Despite my fondness of money, I feel morally obligated to at least split the money evenly between the two of us. This is a fair decision in my opinion.

I just thought it is good to keep things equal and fair. As we could both benefit from having 5 dollars, which could allow you to buy a drink or snack. If I gave myself a larger portion, I see no reason in that as someone can't do much with a few dollars.

Once again, I gave each of us the same amount of $5. I did this because while I do value money more than oatmeal, I think I'm okay with only receiving $5 instead of getting all $10 for myself. It's not big enough of a value for me to worry about giving myself more than my partner.
I thought it would be something nice to do for the other person. If I was randomly given 10 dollars, maybe he would need the money more than I would.
I didn't want to be greedy, and I think it is fair if we just split it. Also i think she would do the same for me.

I allocated the money the way I did because I like my partner, and still wanted to give her money, but I did want to keep a portion for myself. The 60/40 split seemed the most fair since I was still giving her money but got to keep the money given to me.
we both get $5 more than we had at the beginning. And its fair to split it evenly.
Considering that $10 is not all that much money, I decided that I would give her half and keep half for myself to be fair. After all, there's only so much I could do with $5 more.

If my partner saw that I had ten dollars to allocate between us, he might feel a certain way should I keep more or all of the money. I too, would've felt bad not giving him any. It seemed the fairest to split it.
Assuming they would not know I could give them up to 10, plus i do not know them
I wanted to make sure it was even. If they need money, I would probably give them all 10.
I distributed it equally assuming we both want the money.

I chose to split the money evenly because I it would benefit both my partner and I. Even though it's less money than if I were to keep the full $10, I would be more at ease knowing that we both have an equal amount of money for ourselves.
I am not struggling with money; therefore,, I chose to split evenly between us. It is fair that we get the same amount, unless he needed it more than me in which case my answer would change.

Since we were a randomly assigned pair, there's no reason why I would deserve to get more dollars than the other person. If we were playing a game for money like gambling or something then maybe I would have made a rule where i would give the other person more or less than myself.
If given money for free to distribute, I'd want to do it equally. In my opinion it feels the most fair.

I actually introduced and met this person before the study, and splitting the money evenly seems like a nice thing to do, and 50 dollars is still a lot of money currently, which could buy me just over half of my groceries.
I want the money to be evenly divided. It would be unfair for one of us to have more money than the other person.
I decided to give two dollars because it is better than nothing. Both parties are still leaving better off but I am leaving slightly better off.

The 10 dollars was given to me I see no reason to randomly distribute it. Maybe if I was splitting 20 in half my answer would be different but 5 dollars apiece does not go too far between two people. For all I know they were offered the same deal and could have kept their 10 as well.
She seemed like a nice person so I figured if I was sitting next to her, I would split the ten dollars. Figured it would be a nice deed.
I value $10 highly. I was given the $10 so i believe is hould be able too keep it all. if my partner choose to keep it all I would not blame them.
I just wanted to keep it even. Yes, I could keep it all for myself, but I don't think I would morally or ethically feel ok doing that. What if my partner needed the money?
it would be a nice little cup of coffee or something for each of us. the extra $5 isn't a super impactful amount of money so we might as well split it and both walk away happy.
There is an even number of $10 bills, so I gave the both of us a fair share.
It was the most fair, 50-50
because that would be fair. I don't want him to feel left out
we were randomly paired and then given the ten dollars for the two of us. we should just split it evenly so it is fair and all parties are happy.
I know 5 dollars isn't a lot of money but that is something that could cheer up someone's day. Also, if it wasn't my money to begin with I might as well share it.

Money is a big problem of greed and making it fair and optimal I gave him 5 and myself 5 so we could both walk away happy. This amount is not large enough for me to want to be able to split or keep all of it.
The same as the first example. It's even and I'm not going to lose my mind over $5.

I allocated the ten dollars equally between the other participant and myself to keep things fair. I would rather split the $10 with the other person so that we both have the chance to benefit from the money.
I decided to allocate $5 to another participant ($5 for myself) because that way it's an even share and each of us get something out of it. I am not a greedy individual, so an even share seemed best.
He might need the $10 so I chose to give him all of the dollars. I don't need them bad, but maybe he does.
The $10 kind of came from nowhere. Neither one of us did any work for the money so I think we should split it evenly since there is no other reference for how to split the money.
I allocated it evenly between us because it seemed the fairest. If we are randomly getting the money, neither of us did anything to deserve it, so it should be split evenly.
The amount was such a little amount of 10$ so I didn't really mind splitting it in half. It wasn't that big of a deal so I just split it evenly.
Again 50/50 seemed to be the only fair way to divide up the money. I am not in desperate need of $5 and I would rather be fair and just versus seem greedy or greed over $5.
I gave me 9 of the dollars and them 1, I do no really know my partner so that is why I chose to keep the money for me.
Same as above, I split it in half so we each get $5. There isn't really a reason I just think it's fair.
still half and half, and no argument
Again I did this because it is the most fair thing to do and the right thing to do.
I allocated five of the ten dollars to the other participant. Just like the pens, I didn't need all of it, so I decided we could split it.
neither of us "earned" the money. We were given it as a group and it makes sense to split it between us as it is also not a large amount of money.
I would give each of us 5 dollars because it is fair and we both gain the same thing
it is fairest if split evenly. Especially with money i wouldn't want to be greedy and take more
Ultimately, we both gain in the situation provided. So, I saw no reason to take the entire $10 for myself. Even though I may know not much about my partner, why should I treat her that way?
The money was given to us, so it is fair to split it evenly.
we should split the number evenly, that is the only fair way
Split it equally because people value money more than anything. If they saw me receive 10 or 9 dollars and they either got 0 dollars or 1 dollar they might have been upset, as would I.
I do not know the person I was paired with very well. If they did not know I had to split money I would just keep it for myself.

I don't know anyone here doing this research, so I think it would only be reasonable to split it evenly. I don't know anyone's financial situation either and it would be unfair to assume that one other person gets more.

Splitting evenly is probably the proper thing to do, but ultimately when you're given a decision it's almost impossible not to decide what's in your best interest. I would feel some guilt not evenly distributing the money, but I also don't know the person who's receiving it, and their intentions behind spending the money.

We walked in both with $0 and were offered $10. There is no point to be greedy, split the amount between both of us can let us both get a snack today and be happy. We walked out with more money than we had before.
It's fair that we both get the same amount. If i took 7 and gave her 3 it would be unfair of me. If she got 3 and i got 7 it would be unfair to her.
I chose to split the $10 with the other person because it's selfish to just keep all the money. If I always have the choice, I will always split the cost, or anything related to that.
I think that it would only be fair to split the money won because neither of us did anything more than the other to deserve the winnings.
I wanted the money because that allows me to pay for things like food, utilities, rent. etc. Getting this money saves me time and effort.
I split the money evenly so each of us gets $5. It seems the most fair without knowing anything about my partner's financial situation.

I chose for each of us to get the same amount because it just seemed fair. Since it's my first time meeting them, I don't want to give them a bad impression I also don't know if they need the ten dollars more than I do so just keeping it the same just makes it easy.

I would want it to be even. I don't know the other person's financial situation, so I wouldn't choose to give them more. I also wouldn't take more than an equal number because I don't think that is fair.
i would split it evenly because i believe that is the most fair way. if he was in the same position, i hope he would do the same.
I felt like it should be split evenly. We both along very well and he was a very genuine person.
I decided to give myself 5 dollars and my partner also 5 dollars. There is no reason one of us needs more, so I think an even split is the best case.

I thought harder for this scenario, as I was inclined to take all ten for myself, but decided otherwise. The dollar value was low, and like the pens, somewhat insignificant. This led to my decision to split the cash 50/50.

Similarly to the ballpoint pens, I decided to split the $10 evenly between us. This follows the same reasoning as well, because I would not feel comfortable keeping more of the money to myself knowing it would be just as easy to split it evenly.
I wanted the money for myself but, also wanted to give some to my partner. It felt fair that because I found it I got a little more then her and still gave her a good amount.
I would give half of the money to the other participant and keep the other half. I think this proportion is the only way we both get something that is fair.

I chose to equally split the $10 between me and the other participant because it would be strange to not share the same amount with them, especially since i do not know them very well, it would seem rude.
the reason i split the money in half is because that seemed the fairest.
I chose to split evenly among us. I chose this because that is 10 dollars I did not have previously.
Depending on the scenario, I would keep the $10 for myself. If I worked for it, then that is money. If the money was a result of our combined efforts, then I would split it.
I allocated the money equally too. 5 dollars for each of us makes sense and is the easiest way to decide.
I was given the $10 so I don't think I should give anyone any of it unless I want to. Maybe, if my allocated participant was a friend or family I would consider giving them some money.

I think that 10 dollars isn't considered a huge amount of money to become greedy about. That is why I wouldn't care to split a 10-dollar bill with anyone, especially if I have received it as unearned money.

I would allocate $5 out of the $10 to the other participant. I chose this amount because we are dedicating the same amount of time to this study, therefore splitting the dollar amount equally is the fairest approach.
Same reasoning as above. It would be fair if we each get $5
I was given the money. I am not close with my pairing and therefore I would keep all $10 for myself.
I simply split the money between us both ($5 each) because I found that to be the fairest. It simply makes the most sense to split the money.
It's fairest to split the money evenly
I would also split this down the middle, 5 each. I would do this because I believe that this is fair and would hope someone would do the same thing for me!
I chose to take all $10. I did this because it is $10. I could ese this money to get dinner after this or something. I would feel bad to my partner though, but we could always arrange something.
I just split it in half to be fair ($5 for me and $5 for her). I did this so I would not feel guilty about taking more money and leaving her with less.

I believe it's only fair to split the $10 with my partner, so I would split it evenly by giving each of us $5. I think it would be rude to keep all of the money for myself when situated it in front of another person.

I decided to split the money evenly between us because i feel that it is fair. i also thought that it would be awkward if i theoretically had to divide the money in front of him. i wouldn't want to come off as greedy
Because I would feel selfish keeping all 10, and I would feel better giving away half than keeping it.
Similar to the pens, I would feel bad if I did not split the money evenly with the other person. The paired partner was nice and I feel like we deserve the same amount of money.
5 dollars and 10 dollars won't make much of a difference to me so I may as well give my partner 5 too. I would want him to do that for me if roles were reversed.
I decided to split the money in half, $5 each. He seems like a nice person and that is the fair thing to do.
I chose to split it evenly. I did this because that's the fair way.

I just met my partner today during this study, and in the few minutes we spoke, we never discussed nor indicated financial need. Since I was not given much context as to why I was given this money, I didn't really feel a need to offer up any of it or split it up in any way because I had just met her.
I did 5 and 5. I wanted it to be equal.
I don't feel compelled to give someone I just met a portion of my money. He said nothing about needing it and I have no connection to him.

If this exercise were with someone I was unlikely to see again, I would take all 10 dollars. However, being reasonable (as opposed to greedy) is a good way to create connections. Honestly, upon further reflection, I may give all 10 dollars to my partner in hopes that they'll repay the favor someday in another small way.
I believe that it is always good to put others before yourself. Therefore, if it means giving them more to help them out I would.
I gave them $5 dollars of the 10 because it just seemed fair to split it evenly. I don't know them that well but it seemed like the nice thing to do.
We both did the same amount of work here and were partners. That made me decide to share.
It is a fair way of sharing the money we receive for the study. We both have to put effort into it so we both should profit from it.
I prefer to share as it can be mutually beneficial. I look selfish if I take more money and leave my partner with less.

Same reason as the pens. I believe that it is only fair for us to both be given an even amount of whatever was given. We are both here now and also it is only 10 dollars to split not like it is a crazy amount of money
I split it evenly as that is fair since we both participated in the study. That is morally the right thing to do.

I gave myself $5 and her $5 because she is also a participant and knows how much I would have taken. I wanted to make it fair and even because I did not want her upset or to get a bad impression of me.
